body: Hi all, There is an issue of running the Honeybee_Indoor View Factor Calculator Component. Cannot get any result from the component of  Viewfactormesh. Thanks for your help! [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/FSsZCl811baSOQYzkGVhdksCiQX9sle9gY*9oaZcUv5NNVRMNiAX*EyUhiy5a3iTXUvaBg22LmV-9s1LaNTDg7v3nKKO4e*6/algrithm1.jpg)[](http://api.ning.com:80/files/FSsZCl811bYsPxA2HQyJME1iVdhQ1O7tFrhIZkJpusaIfGD8pRXLKE3swXUBtFRViT7-5yD5L3JwFeLGNPGqXwb7wOa8yqZP/algrithm1.jpg)
topic: Unable to use  the Honeybee_Indoor View Factor Calculator

replies.body: Shengji, There are no floor surfaces within your energy model: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/LuvHCR6YrSJxzAo1C0PaxcN9t*kHhooEBUsAXP3Yfrm7nD4aSvduC8EZjpr7WysqaZc2*EXBI*Ng5IKz2W2Vw0BclTCxAPb3/NoFloors.JPG) Therefore, plugging in a number to distFromFloorOrSrf_ or using the default number will produce no test points at which to evaluate comfort.  I would suggest either building your energy model with floor surfaces or, if there truly are no floors, plug in a Brep into the distFromFloorOrSrf_ input on the View Factor component. -Chris

Hi Chris,

Thank you so much for your reply. It works so I can create prototypes of atrium showing the performance of visual comfort and thermal comfort. Again, I appreciate your help and your lecture in Penn designwas amazing!
